newsitem.title: FRANCE: Vendex seeks BIS minority buyout approval.
newsitem.headline: Vendex seeks BIS minority buyout approval.

text.p: The SBF stock markets association said on Thursday Dutch retail and business services group Vendex International had submitted proposals for a buyout of minorities at French temporary work firm BIS.

The SBF said in a statement the plan had been submitted to the French financial markets watchdog and involved a buyout at 490 francs per share and that trading in BIS shares had been suspended until further notice.

Vendex announced an agreement in January to purchase a stake of close to 60 percent of BIS held by the family of the late founder Laurent Negro at 490 francs per share. It said at the time it would bid the same price for the shares listed on the Paris bourse.
